profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on December 14, 2007

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: The State Planning Board coordinated and integrated information pertaining to growth and development of the State. They collected information, data and maps from across departmental lines and made the information available to all. There were several projects initiated by the Board relating to water quality, forests, highways, population demographics and zoning. An aerial map of the State was considered “the most essential single step for our state-wide data.”

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In the summer of 1933, President Roosevelt created the National Planning Board, later to become the National Resources Board. That same year, Governor Wilbur L. Cross appointed a Connecticut State Planning Board. The Board coordinated and integrated information pertaining to growth and development of the State. They collected information, data and maps from across departmental lines and made the information available to all. There were several projects initiated by the Board relating to water quality, forests, highways, population demographics and zoning. An aerial map of the State was considered “the most essential single step for our state-wide data.” [Connecticut State Planning Board, Statement #9, April 4, 1934. CSL call number: ConnDoc P693 st] In 1935, the General Assembly passed legislation officially creating the State Planning Board, which superseded the so-called Governor’s Board created under executive authority.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records consist of reports and summary of work.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: RG 005:026, Wilbur L. Cross gubernatorial records, 1931-1939.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Connecticut. State Planning Board -- Records and correspondence
Regional planning -- Connecticut

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

unittitle.bibref: Davis, I. G. "Agricultural Production in New England." In New England's Prospect, 1933. New York: American Geographical Society: 1933.

"Report to the Connecticut State Planning Board for the first six months work January 12 to July 12, 1934" by George H. Gray.

"Report on Land Planning Agencies and Data" prepared by George H. Gray, Director & Planning Consultant, Connecticut State Planning Board, August 25, 1934, to L. C. Gray, Director, Land Section, National Resource Board.

"A Condensed Report on Planning for Connecticut" by George H. Gray, Planning Consultant, Based on Experience to October 9, 1934) to Charles W. Eliot, 2nd, Executive Officer of the National Resource Board, In Compliance with Bulletin #B-5.
"Development of State Provision for Recreation" by Connecticut State Planning Board, 1936.
